title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Château de Plantigny  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: Produced from vines around the grand chateau, this is a crisp wine that has banana flavors and tight red-currant acidity that is crisp and lightly perfumed. It will probably be softer from early 2017.

title: Louis Tête 2015 Les Sableux  (Beaujolais)
description: The wine is nothing but fresh cherries from vines grown on sandy soil. Light tannins and bright fruitiness are the wine's hallmarks, giving a crisp, lively aftertaste.

title: Four Sisters Ranch NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma County)
description: Pinkish-orange in color, this is made from 84% Pinot Noir and 16% Pinot Meunier and offers a wealth of ripe cherry and strawberry. Dry, it has a taste of sour orange and is fairly simple, without much in the way of a finish. The acidity is quite moderate.

title: Henry Fessy 2015  Beaujolais
description: A soft banana and cherry-flavored wine that has attractive acidity and only the lightest of tannins. It is bright, fruity and ready to drink.

title: Heron Hill 2014 Ingle Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Refreshing acidity brightens this lean, light-bodied Chardonnay. Fresh tangerine and lemon notes are pleasant but demure, shaded by more savory, rustic tones. Finishes briskly.

title: Oak Grove 2013 Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine offers attractive vanilla and red-cherry aromas plus bright cherry flavors. It has a tangy texture due to crisp acidity and moderate tannins.

title: Roquevale 2015 Ossa Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: Named after the range of mountains close to the Roquevale winery, this wine is ripe, soft and offers an attractive series of red fruits and rich tannins. Drink this wine now.

title: Eximius NV Semi-Dry Sparkling (Cava)
description: A familiar Cava aroma of lime sets up a foamy, active palate. Lime, mango and Thompson Seedless flavors finish quick yet clean.

title: Reinert Project 2014 All In Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Fairly shy on the nose, this wine eventually shows lemon pith, lemon candy and slightly sweet aromas. The flavors start crisp but go quickly flatter, with light Pink Lady apples and a touch of orange rinds.

title: Rigal 2014 Oltesse Malbec (Cahors)
description: This is a fruity, perfumed wine with just enough structure to keep it all together. Fresh and with red fruit flavors, it is already drinkable.

title: Paradisone 2013  Rosso di Montalcino
description: This opens with aromas of leafy underbrush, incense and a balsamic note of menthol. The evolved palate has seen fresher days, showing steeped prune, raisin and the warmth of evident alcohol alongside firm but not very persistent tannins that dry out the finish. The fruit has largely dried up.

title: Prophecy 2014 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This wine blends an earthy aroma with plenty of soft, almost sweet fruit character and a gentle, easy-drinking texture.

title: Heron Hill 2014 Ingle Vineyard Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Bolder and fuller in body than Heron Hill's standard Chardonnay, the Ingle Vineyard boasts delicate hints of blossom, green apple and lime. Savory tones of bramble, smoke and stem tend to overwhelm, but overall, the wine offers brisk refreshment.

title: Hey Mambo 2013 Sultry Red (California)
description: This lightly sweet wine has an intense oaky, peppery, smoky aroma and the flavors come out the same way. The beefy, liquid-smoke character should match ribs in barbecue sauce.

title: Sagelands 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of tire rubber, plum and spice are followed sweet currant and cranberry flavors. The tannins bring some grit.

title: Saint-Jean des Sources 2015 Picpoul (Languedoc)
description: Aromas of white clover, carnation and lime leaf lead the nose of this crisp and easy white. Fruity tones of underripe peach and melon rind unfold on the palate, coupled with zippy lime-like acidity and a saline streak that lifts the close. Drink up.

title: Solar de Cambres 2015 Casa de Cambres Colheita Branco White (Douro)
description: This is a highly perfumed, fruity wine with ripe melon and spiced apple flavors. It is crisp, tangy and attractively textured with fine acidity. Drink now.

title: Lomas del Valle 2015 Coastal Cool Climate Wine Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)
description: Medicinal cherry and red-plum aromas come with a whiff of latex. This feels plump, chunky and grabby. Medicinal candied-berry flavors end with racy acidity. This seems like a full step down from the 2014 version.
designation: Coastal Cool Climate Wine Single Vineyard

title: Ventisquero 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
description: Vegetal notes, mild citrus and sulfuric aromas make up the nose of this fresh but limited SB. Herbal, peppery green-fruit flavors are lean and finish with notes of rosemary and other green herbs.

title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 La Rose Pourpre Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)
description: Finely structured, this is a fruity wine with bright cherry fruit and acidity. It has a drier edge that gives it texture and shape. The fresher aftertaste gives the wine a fruity lift. Drink now.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Pegos Claros Rosé (Palmela)
description: An attractive rosé, made from 100% Castelão, the local grape of Setúbal peninsula. It is crisp with citrus and ripe with raspberry giving a fine balance and refreshing character. Drink now.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Monte das Promessas Red (Alentejano)
description: This producer, based in the Lisboa region, has branched out into the Alentejo to source this rich, generously ripe wine. With its full-bodied plum and spice flavors, it is soft with a light touch of tannin. Drink now.

title: Château du Cèdre 2015 Cedrus le Blanc White (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: A blend of Ugni Blanc and Colombard from Gascony, the wine has crisp herbaceous flavors and a tight zesty texture. It is light, refreshing and ready to drink.

title: Château du Cèdre 2015 Cedrus Malbec (Comté Tolosan)
description: Light and fruity, this wine has blackberry flavors to balance its soft texture and dusty tannins. The wine has an earthy edge to go with its simple fruit and lively acidity. Drink now.

title: Clos Troteligotte 2015 K-Pot' Malbec (Cahors)
description: From organic grapes and bottled without added sulfur, this is a fruity juicy wine with a strangely perfumed, geranium character. It has soft tannins, and hints of red fruits behind the perfume. The aftertaste is the only firm part of this fresh wine, which can be drunk young.

title: Dancing Coyote 2015 White (Clarksburg)
description: Fruity, soft and rather sweet, this wine smells and tastes like apple and pear juice. It has low acidity, medium body and a sugary finish.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Brigando Rosé (Lisboa)
description: A light and fruity wine that is deliciously crisp with raspberry flavors and is nicely cut with acidity. Drink now.

title: Domaine Gioulis 2015 Sofos The Wise One Moschofilero-Chardonnay (Peloponnese)
description: This Moschofilero/Chardonnay blend feels a bit overwrought, with a boozy nose of vanilla, dried apricot and spice and flavors of citrus fruit and cedar. It also has a nice exotic character that will pair well with heartier fish dishes and cheese. Drink now.

title: Domaine Saint-Rémy 2015 Vieilles Vignes Riesling (Alsace)
description: This wine has a muddy aspect to the nose. The palate is fresh and sprightly but a little dilute and derives its fruit from a light, refreshing lemon note.

title: Montes 2013 La Finca Clos d'Angel Malbec (Colchagua Valley)
description: This forcefully oaked, jammy Malbec smells like plastic, wood grain and cassis. The palate is a bit sticky. Flavors are herbal and sugary at the same time, while leftover herbal flavors control a low-acid finish.
